abstract: Merrill’s attempt to align pay with performance did not keep executives from risking the bank’s stability.
snippet: Merrill’s attempt to align pay with performance did not keep executives from risking the bank’s stability.
lead_paragraph: It sounds like something Washington’s pay czar might propose to rein in runaway bonuses on Wall Street.

headline.main: In Merrill’s Failed Plan, Lessons for Pay Czar
headline.print_headline: In Merrill’s Failed Plan, Lessons for Pay Czar

abstract: The Finger family, a big and dissatisfied shareholder, wants Bank of America to pick an outsider to replace Kenneth D. Lewis as chief executive, arguing that the current top management is “tainted and not credible.”
snippet: The Finger family, a big and dissatisfied shareholder, wants Bank of America to pick an outsider to replace Kenneth D. Lewis as chief executive, arguing that the current top management is “tainted and not credible.”
lead_paragraph: The Finger family of Houston, a big and very dissatisfied shareholder in Bank of America, wants the bank’s board to pick an outsider to replace its chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, arguing that the current top management is “tainted and not credible.”

headline.main: BofA Shareholder Opposes Insiders to Replace Lewis
